definition: variation
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
variation (music)

sentences.english: The background music for the recitation is a variation of the song "Ode to Red Flag".
sentences.chinese: 《紅旗頌》的變奏是詩朗誦的音樂背景。

sentences.english: The group perform variations on soul and gospel music.
sentences.chinese: 這個樂隊演奏靈歌和福音音樂的變奏曲。
爲鋼琴而作的有變奏的行板。

sentences.english: In the melody creation commonly used "adds the flowered variation" the technique.
sentences.chinese: 在旋律的創作上，常用“加花變奏”的手法。
謎語變奏曲，作品36之9，獵手。

sentences.english: Green Variations of Waste Vegetable oils.
sentences.chinese: 回收油的綠色變奏曲工作坊。

sentences.english: Five variations for piano on "Rule Britannia".
sentences.chinese: 五對“第大不列顛”鋼琴變奏曲。

sentences.english: It has a rollicking beat and follows bluesy changes, but is played with country instruments.
sentences.chinese: 它具有歡快的旋律與藍調的變奏，並由鄉村樂器伴奏。

sentences.english: This famous musician is working on a series of variations on large scale.
sentences.chinese: 著名的音樂家正在創作一部大型變奏曲。

sentences.english: Of course, there are variations to this theme.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這一主旋律也有變奏。

definition: to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
to arrange
musical composition
to pile up/to put layer upon layer/(Tw) (computing) stack
light and quick/brisk/spry/lively/effortless/relaxed/agile/blithe
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
gradual progress/to go forward one stage at a time
to reappear
to deconstruct
advanced guard/vanguard/avant-garde/forward (soccer position)
brand new
to arrange/to lay out
to weave/to knit/to plait/to braid/(fig.) to create (sth abstract, e.g. a dream, a lie etc)
